fields.summary: NC continually reruns init when CC libs are installed, spamming logs

fields.description:
Quick Launch Maint-4.3 source builds fail to start CC if SELinux is enforcing. More general, anytime NC and CC binaries are on the same host and SELinux is enforcing, the CC will fail to start. This has been verified for package builds of maint-4.3 and maint-4.4 (presumably master as well)

To reproduce:
(a) using build from source
# Do a QuickLaunch maint-4/3 source install with selinux enforcing

(b) using a pacakge build
# Do a QL maint-4.3 package build with SELinux enforcing and change to a topology with everything on one host
# You may observe the cluster is still ready at first but there will still be some AVC messages. Restart the CC service and it will now fail to start and there are some additional AVC messages 

(c) on an existing package build
# on a machine running a CC do {{yum install eucalyptus-nc}} 
# No need to start the nc process, just the presence of the binaries will trigger the condition (you may beed to restart the CC process)

In each scenarios you can observe there are AVC messages in the auditd log. To check out the AVC messages and the policy needed:
# yum install -y policycoreutils-python
# ausearch --start recent --success no | audit2why
# ausearch --start recent --success no | audit2allow
fields.summary: SELinux + CC and NC colocated = failure to start CC

comments.body: This old euca bug was brought up (EUCA-12148), but I think this is probably euca-cb related since the policies are loaded for package builds and master source builds.

We think this is caused by how libraries get loaded. And it is a problem when the CC and NC packages or binaries are both on the same system and SELiunx is enabled and enforcing. It was first noticed in source builds because we build all eucalyptus components on all hosts. Thus every host has CC and NC binaries. It was confirmed on a package build where I had a functioning default topology cloud from packages, then just did a {{yum install eucalyptus-nc}} after which the AVC messages began to arise as well as the defund http processes.

{code}
root     49919 47977  0 19:14 pts/1    00:00:00         grep --color=auto httpd
root     39813     1  0 18:57 ?        00:00:01   /usr/sbin/httpd -f //run/eucalyptus/httpd-cc.conf -DFOREGROUND
eucalyp+ 49914 39813  0 19:14 ?        00:00:00     [httpd] <defunct>
eucalyp+ 49915 39813  0 19:14 ?        00:00:00     [httpd] <defunct>
eucalyp+ 49916 39813  0 19:14 ?        00:00:00     [httpd] <defunct>
eucalyp+ 49917 39813  0 19:14 ?        00:00:00     [httpd] <defunct>
{code}

AVC messages
{code}
----
